S.FORM: Na isnavaan in, munkumbu masnanava, tupa taimi’isnanavan tu, “mindangkaza! mastauqtauq!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: Pidaingun zami qalinga tupa tu, “sinsi miqumisang!”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: Isnavan aam a, sinsi masnava isisipul i itumalasBunn tu qalinga
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Bunun language of numbers.

S.FORM: Sisisli aam sinsi masipul, tusasaus aam isisipul tu sintusasaus.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: Mapasnava aak madia tu itumalasBunun tu qalinga.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Bunun languages.

S.FORM: Qanglas aak munKaku, qanglas aak mapasnava malasBunun qalinga, na bazbaz aak patan’a ki Tina.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Bunun language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: Maa naak ngan a Tulbus
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Tulbus。
My name is Tulbus.

S.FORM: Maa naak Tama ngan a tupaun tu Sipal.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Sipal。
My dad’s name is Sipal.

S.FORM: Maa naak Tina ngan a tupan tu Mai’ia.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Mai’ia。
My mother’s name is Mai’ia.

S.FORM: Mas’an naak haip punsanan qamisan.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: Haiza naak tas’a masituqas-nanaz tupaun ngan tu Vilian, mas’an qan tas’a istaa qamisan
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Vilian，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Vilian, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: Muskun aam ihaan tas’a kaku vingkiu.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: Ma aak siin masituqas-nanaz naak a mazima aam tusasaus.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: Mazima aak tun’apap, maqi pal’un a, amin aam tastulumaq muskun tun’apap.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: Mazima aak mapasaqal baqlu kaviaz, maqtu aam muskun tusasaus siin tun’apap.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: Bunun siduq aak tu uvaz’az.
S.TRANSL: 我是布農族的小孩。
I am an Bunun child.

S.FORM: Inaam lumaq ihaan Bahu’an.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在馬遠。
Our family lives in Bahu’an.

S.FORM: Inaak tastulumaq haiza hahima bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: Inaam tastulumaq haiza tatau tais’aan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: Muskun aak Tama, Tina, masituqas-nanaz siin masituqas-nau’az katuskun aam.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: Inaak Tama malaungkav, Sasbinaz naak Tama ka.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: Innak Tina makuis, Ising naak Tina ka.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: Maaq Tama ihaan lumaq a malasBnun pabazbaz zami.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Bunun language with us at home.

S.FORM: Maqei pal’un aam a musuqais aam mun asang.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: Muskun aak inaak masituqas-nanaz masituqas-nau’az madamu auk’auk.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: Mazima aak inaak tastulumaq tu Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: Haip qanian dusa aak Tina munata qaitmal.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: Qanian tu diqanin masanglav saa, nii tu makazhav nii amin mabaqais, makahav a luvluv.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: Ihaan aam nastu ismuut mamaun i anpang, sanvaliun valih a hubung, manangqat saa.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: Tinaungqu’, tindangqas in na diqanin.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: Tupauk Tina tu, mavia ka diqanin madangqas.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: Tupa Tina tu, na lauq naluvluvan.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: Sanavan diqanin uka luhum, santasal in bintuqan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: Na mudanin amin aam mulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: Ihaan na mulumaq tu daan, taquan zaku a bintuqan inaak tu aikas’angan.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: Duu maqtu luvluvan nii tu minsuma, asang aak munata qaitmal.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: Ma naak Kaku a ihaan inaak lumaq di’ngalan, qanglas aak tan’anak munKaku, tan’anak amin musuqais lumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: Nii naam Kaku madaing, nii amin papia pantu, pasasaqal amin.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: Kaupa ka pantu mu’anpuk haan daisiqdaing, muskun aam qaitmal mali, muskun pababazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: Maqa Sinsi a muskun amin zami qaitmal, maqa Kaku a maszang tastulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: Maisiqailis aam ma’asik, mintus aam piningzav inaam pasnanavan tu da’ngianan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: Haiza a maqaiqais vanas, haiza a ma’asik.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: Ma’asikang aam amin Kaku tu sikaupa tansiki’an, mintus kaskun kuzakuza, maqa Kaku a na malniningzavin.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: Takna, munhaan aak asang tantungu haan Aki.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: Talmadiin aam nii tu mapasadu, minliliskin aak istaa.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: Sadu a Aki zaku, pakaun zaku ki sikua, paquu zaku ucia.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: Sinsuaz Aki tu sikua madavusdaingaz, tutuza tu masihal saa kaunun.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: Mazima aak amin Aki tu ucia, masihal amin quudan.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: Isaan tinaungqu, dusa aak Bai mapit’ia paitutaungqu.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: Mapit’ia ka Bai madia tu paitutaungqu, haiza iskaan, haiza maitulkuk, haiza bahat, haiza ang siqut.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: Minaun in paitutaungqu, munhaan aam patsanglavan mati’ngus sanglav.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: Siza Bai madia tu hutan, tai siin salu-pinasaq masaiv zaku, nadasun dau zaku pulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: Tukakivuk aingka, tupauk tu namuqna mapasaduu intaa.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: Haip qanian dasun aam Sinsi munhaan patsinanaipukan, ihaan aam hilav pandailaz namabaliv i kipu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Munkumbu in aam haan patsinanaipukan a, tupa Sinsi tu, “maqa malngus a tastuluqei, maqa tanhiku a tastu’ivut anaka amu saduu.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: Mapising aak ivut, paqpun nii aak saduu ivut.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: Saidu in aak madia luqei, isaan aingka lukis kusbabai, haiz’ang saduu ki bitquh ihaan luak lukis masabaq.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: Patsinanaipukan kumbu haiza zau, uma, lauhu, mainaqabas nii ang saiduu sinanaipuk tun, saiduu in haip mananu manaskal saa.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: Madia naak sinpaisasing, na pasaduu zaku Tama Tina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: Maqei muqnin na muskun aak Tama Tina masaupa tii.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: Ma haip pal’un qanian, dusa aak masituqas-nau’az munhaan Taitu’ tantungu haan pantamaun ta.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: Maina haan aam Taihuku tunlaihlai munhaan Taitu’.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: Panhaan in Taitu’ a, pantamaun ma’unting laihlaih munhaan papandu’an antala zami.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: Papandu’an i pantamaun ta lumaq nii tu pakadaqvis, maun’ting muhiav a pandipin.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: Pantamaun lumaq dingalan haiza madaing tu sasaipukan sinanaipuk, muskun aam tuntauntaun munhaan sasaipukan sinanaipuk.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: Ihaan sasaipukan sinanaipuk ta, dasun aam pantamaun mapakaun i sidih siin tun’uma.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: Sanavan, muskun aam muhaan malalabasan dangi’anan ma’un.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: Madia malalabasan dangi’anan ta laihlaih, paqpun tundaza aam pautpat mun’ita.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: Namudanin a, sadu tu tangqai’iu’un a pautpaut, lusqa in aam tunvasu mudaan.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: Maa laupadau aam musqais in haan Taihuku, nii niap tu ukiliman in naupa panTamaun tu pautpaut.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: Atikis ang aak ihaan aam lumaq Bahu’an, pantu in aak a, tunlusqu in panhaan Taihuku, lusbut in haan Tukai miqumis.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在馬遠，上學以後，就搬到了台北，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Bahu’an. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: Vingkiu in Zaingaku a, mapasnava aak pali’uni takiSilazan vungka tu ispasnanava, mingqansiapin tu haizan vaivivaivi tu vungka.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: Paqpun, haip pusana talaban pal’uun, dusa aam inaak masituqas-nanaz musuqis asang tantungu haan madadaingaz, na asa minqansiap anakanak siduq tu vungka.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: Madaingaz haizin tu mavaun qamisan, qaal saduan maszangang talutbu tu Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: Masi’ngav aak istaa tu maaq suu qansaipun qalinga, isia taa sinpalasBunun madauzung, maqansiap amin malasBantalang, malasNgaingai, malasPuut.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的布農語說得很流利，也會說阿美語、客家話和閩南話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Bunun, as well as Pangcah, Hakka and Hokkien.

S.FORM: Masingav istaa minqansiap in tu, paqan i uvaz’az ang aipa mapasnava in malasBantalang, Ngaingai istaa binanau’az, qaal ihaan isiata kuzkuzaun saqal i Puut, paqpun maqansiap aipa madia vaivivaivi tu qalinga.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學阿美話，太太是客家人，而他工作上認識許多閩南人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Pangcah when he was a child, his wife is an Hakka, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: Maaq aam mapabazbaz a, maqa madaingaz a pali’uni madia itu qabasan qanup tu kaitaiklasan.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: Qaal nii aam maqtu ma’laz itqaal tan’a, qaal kusia aam soci sizaan qalinga, na maqtu uqnaun ikmantuk tan’a.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: Uvaz’az ang aak nii ang uqansaipan anakanak siduq tu vungka, malka anakanak tu takiSilazan a maz’av saa.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: Madia in ingqansaipun a, dungzav in minqansiap tu Bunun siduq aak, tuza tu makitvaivi, mananu tu maqtu na iskukuniv.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為布農族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Bunun is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: Haip qanian tu minsanavan, masinauba-nanaz na mulumaqin.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: zaku siin bai munhaan babalivan tulkuk, palhanus mapit’ia paitusanavan na pakaun i masinauba-nanaz.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: Angqai aam babalivan sanglav, ihaan babalivan-sanglav haiza madia baqlu siniza tu sanglav.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: Mabaliv aam sanglav-kabu, tanbuna siin ningzing.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: Di’ngalan Taimibabalivan ququt’aqun tu Bunun tupatu, “ma naak bunglai siin qalup madavus. Mabaliva tu tikis maa!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: Mabaliv in aam bunglai siin qalup.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: Angqai aam babalivan titi’, tupa Taimibabalivan tu, “maaq suu nabalivun? maaq haip a tulkuk madaing tu ma’avula, tas’a ka tau saba sui.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: Bai tinliskin tu maqlis saa, masingav i Taimibabalivan tu duu maqtu nii tu piqlisun.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: Qaal tupa ka Taimibabalivan tu nanu in tu nii tu maqlis, niin maqtu vanaqan maa.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: Dingalan tu Taimibabalivan tupa tu zain mabaliv inaak iskaan, inaak iskaan madaing tu nii tu maqlis.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: Kinuz in mabaliv aam tulkuk mabaliv amin iskaan, kalumaqin in mapit’ia ki tastu’sukui tu sanglav.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: Talmadia mantala, tinmaqmut in a diqanin.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: Masinauba-nanaz kazingva musuqis taqu, taisangdangian tisqa nii tu maqtu pal’un, na muqnin tu lihai minsuma.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: Tupa ka Bai tu haizin madia a pinit’ia, amin i luklas tu zain ma’un!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: Tan’ali aam kaupa tais’aan, muskun a ma’un madia sinpit’ia tu paitusanavan.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: Haiza naak u’uskunan vingkiu tupaun tu Lumav, qanglas aipa panpungul madas qaimangsut.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫魯馬夫，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Lumav, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: Maqi isnavan a, simul aipa isia ta u’uskunan vingkiu tu ispapatas, isqaqaiqais maqi nii a papatasan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: Mutas’a, mudusa, mutau, amin pasimul istaa qaimangsut.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: Qaal haiza istaa madikla tu sinkuzakuza, qanglas simul a nii tu masuqis.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: Kinuzin a amin as’nii mapasimul istaa.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: Haiza tu tas’a qanian, muskun aam munata mudandan qaitmal.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: Ihaan daan, asa Lumav munhaan unanataan, qaal panpungul madas isqaqaisu.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，魯馬夫想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Lumav wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: Simul aipa haan u’uskunan vingkiu i isqaqaisu, qaal amin antalam tu, nii aak amin saimadas.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: Lumav minkaivakaiva santangis. Mahau aipa tupa tu, mavia amuu nii tu pasimul i isqaqaisu!
S.TRANSL: 魯馬夫急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Lumav burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: U’uskunan vingkiu taqu istaa, aupa nii aas anak madas, amin tu pasimul suu tu qaimangsut, nii tu masuqis!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: Laqbingin munKaku, Lumav tingmut ang munKaku in, Lumav butun istaa sinimulan u’uskunan tu qaimangsut suqaisun in istaa.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，魯馬夫很早就到學校了，魯馬夫把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Lumav arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: Lumav mansumanai i u’uskunan ta, musasu tupa tu na anak in madas qaimangsut, man uninang u’uskunan vingkiu maqtu haihaip ti mapasimul qaimangsut.
S.TRANSL: 魯馬夫向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Lumav apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: Inaak Tama sia asang qaqanup tu Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: Maaq aak atikis ang a, Tama siin Pantamaun ihaan sanavan mudaan, madas i via siin busul.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: Tintusqangngin a, madas aingka qainanup tu titi’ musuqis.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: Mintun sia vanis, mintun sia haval, duanduan haiza amin linas
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: 6. Isan aingka asang ngaus daan pisihalun mapaqusil qainanupan, maqusil i asang tu Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: Qailis aak buntu tupaki Tama, na sanlavi ki Tama qanup.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Tupa ka Tama tu na tudip i taldaingin aas na tudip aipa madas zaku.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: Asang tu banananaz kusia amin haqu madamu taklilibus, matas’i aingka haqu-musqut siin haqu-batu.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: Inaak Tama maqansiap saa matas’i haqu-musqut, tupa Tama tu, maaq aipi a is’patishaqu ki linas, asa ata tu masailang napatishaqun tu dapan, haqu pisanun angqaqaiban na patishaqun tu daan.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: Tis’unin na maqtu kava makilavi madadaingaz muskun qanup, mai’siqalis qanian tanam aak matas’i ki haqu, dungzavin inaak tu haqu maqtu in utishaquan.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: Sadun a Tama ka malkazaku tupa tu na ma dau aak qabasin a nii tu kantang tu qaqanup Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: Lapadau taldaingngin aak, mama’ aak inaak tu busulkaka siin kuus, kinuzkinuz i Tama muskun qanup.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Musuqis in asang butun sinqainanup tu titi’ isngunu ki tastu asang Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: Tupa ka Tama tu, asa tu matumasqing tamadaza tu sintuqumis, na maqtu ata uqanupan madia tu qainanup.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: Halasan aak tingmut munkaku.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: Ma’almunkaku a, panpungul aak madas i kavaang.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: Uka naak qaimangsut dasun.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: Maqei isnavan a, muskun aak u’uskunan sadu haqil.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: Maqei siking a, u’uskunan pasimul zaku inpicu siin isqaqaisqais.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: Tupa sinsi zaku “Maqei muqnin asa tingmutang minnuqu, asa nii’in tu halasan!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: Inaak kaviaz tupaun tu Sipal, Bunun siduq aipa amin.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Sipal，他也是布農族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Sipal, and he is also an Bunun child.

S.FORM: Muskun aam ihaan Bahuan asang vingkiu.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在馬遠村部落讀書。
We study together in the Bahuan tribe.

S.FORM: Qanglas aam muskun tan’a madadaingaz paliqabasan, maqansiap aam malasBunun.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說布農族。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Bunun proficiently.

S.FORM: Madaqvas aak amin tu maqulpiq, ma Sipal a maputis tu makuis.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Sipal很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Sipal is short and thin.

S.FORM: Matamasaz a Sipal, amin mazima istaa.
S.TRANSL: Sipal很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Sipal is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: Haip qanian isia Kaku tu unzukai, kaku kuzakuza ki madia tu ispaintavtaiv.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: Haiza pasibutbut, pakantundaq mali’, Mapasinap, iungi, manaq manaqbusulkavil.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: Paintaivtaiv aam tindakul.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: Maqi tindakul aak a, mutingkul aak, madia pisqaidang haan qaa.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: qaal mindangkaz aak, maldauk masinipa ngaus tindangkul.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: Panhaanin aak pas’upa’an amin a bunun manahip.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: anatupa niitu usizaan titas’a ngan, qaal manaskal aak, aupa saukanaqtungin aak paintaivtaiv.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: takna dusa aamTama tantungu munhaan patamaun.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: pantamau ta bantas milu’lu’.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: taqu aipa zami, lumaq tu tavi mubuat tas’a tu luak.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: matas’i aipa tavi ka, maina tavi muqalqal pan’nastu.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: madas tama ka maiqanvangtiti siin saviki masaiv i pantamaun.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: dusa aam pantamaun ihaan sapalan pababazbaz, mangunu aipa taqu madia tu paliqabasan.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: na mudaan tanangaus, patamaun tusqeing zaku tu taldaqvasin, mintalmaindu’in.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: tupa aak tu, mantala pantamaun i minsihalin bantas, muqnin minsuma haan lumaq naam qaitmal.
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: ihaan dusa-singing tu mapusan qan dusa qamisan, sihu tau’aniv Pali’uni takiSilazan mivunsiu maqtu pintas’aun siduq ngan tu paliqansiap.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: mintivi masingav i malbuntu malka sihu taidangazsiza mivunsiu, paltas’aun madailaz a siduq ngan, tu asang mainduduaz Sipal.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Sipal。
I interviewed Sipal, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: paitupa’in aam ihaan haip pal’uun tu diqanin munhaan isiataa lumaq masingav istaa.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: ihaan tantungu tu aingqaiban, malka zaku aipa taqu maimaquaq isiataa tu ngan, dasun aak mapasaqal isiataa tu tastulumaq, isiataa asang.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: masingav aak istaa mavia masaa tu asa huvaivan a ngan, tatu’un tu sinpatuki patasan nii tu masihal?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: malka zaku aipa tupa, aupa makumalasTaluu mapatas nii maqtu mamantuk taqu ki isiataa tu ngan, duma bunun maldaukang luklas i siata tu “si’sien’sen”, paqpun minhaiza pinqainanun i bunun.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Xi Xian Sheng

S.FORM: tupa Sipal tu, takiSilazan qalinga ispapatas tu ngan sia imita mamantuk tu ngan. Inaak tu ngan min’uni inaam tu siduq, inaam tu tastuqabu, inaam tu hubungsinpangqal, maqtu’ang haiza madia siduq tais’aan ukiliman sisuqaisun tu ngan.
S.TRANSL: our family
Sipal said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: dusa aak takna inaak bai munhaan u’a’anpukan mapunhapav babalivan, madas a bai madia kai’anaakan sinsuaz tu sanglav, matas’i amin itutakiSilazan kaununkaunun isaiv i bunun.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: amin mazima isia bai tu babalivan, madia bunun mabaliv i dabuut siin pa’is, madia amin patanamun ma’un isiataa sihanat isquul.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: sinhanat tu palaqu siin hakhak mananu masihal kaunun, haizang makusia maivanis laas mahanat qaimus sumalan titi’, hivhiv sakun madia a bunun silansanun, amin ihaan inaam tu babalivan kanadailaz.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: ma’almahanat bai kakaunun a, ihaan aak dingalan tau’aniv i bunun. Idingalan aak ma’isqit luklas tu, “Sanglav amin kai’anakan masuaz, tail’anaak tal’ia, kavaa mabali maa!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: inaam tu kanunkaunun mahiav aminunin isbaliv, tupa bai tu, “Aupa amin mu’u ka mindangaz! ”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: maqa kuzkuzaun a, uqansaipan aak pali’uni takiSilazan tu ismumuut siin kakaunun tu kaiqansaipan, amin tu aingqai’in malkamababaliv tu kaisaingu’an.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: saduu i bai malka’ituqabasan kakaunun tu kaizima’an, maupat aak mastaan makuniv tu matumasqing.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
